import MethodEndpoint from "@theme/ApiExplorer/MethodEndpoint";
import ParamsDetails from "@theme/ParamsDetails";

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Get issue roles"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"get"}
  path={"/api/v1.0/issues/{issueId}/roles"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Retrieves role configuration for a specific issue, including enabled/disabled role lists. Use this to understand which roles can see or use the issue option.

**Prerequisites**
1. **issueId** - Use [GET /api/v1.0/issues](/docs/api/issues/list-issues) or [POST /api/v1.0/issues](/docs/api/issues/search-issues) and extract `Items[].IssueId`.

**Workflow Example**
1. Identify the issue to inspect.
2. Fetch roles: [GET /api/v1.0/issues/\{issueId\}/roles](/docs/api/issues/get-issue-roles).
3. Use the response to drive role visibility settings or audits.

**Minimal Required Fields**: issueId (path).

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

<ParamsDetails
  parameters={[{"name":"issueId","in":"path","required":true,"schema":{"type":"string","format":"uuid"}}]}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

<RequestSchema
  title={"Body"}
  body={undefined}
>
  
</RequestSchema>
